title: Teaching
text:
I have experience teaching courses both at the bachelor and at the master’s level at Aarhus University.

MA course: Electoral Systems: Do They Really Matter? (course convenor and lecturer). Syllabus.
BA course: Political Institutions: Western Countries, EU, and Foreign Policy (teaching assistant)

I have also experience supervising students in individual seminars, where they are asked to produce a long essay.

title: Edoardo Alberto Viganò
text:
Email

     Linkedin
  

  
  
Welcome! I am a Post-Doctoral researcher at the Department of Philosophy, Politics, and Economics at the University of Witten/Herdecke. Previously, I was a PhD candidate at Aarhus University, Department of Political Science.
In my dissertation, I study the determinants and the consequences of legislators’ efforts to represent local constituents through parliamentary activities. My research interests include parliaments, party politics, and electoral systems. Methodologically, I am interested in quantitative text analysis and causal inference.
You can contact me at edoardo.vigano@uni-wh.de. My CV can be downloaded here.


PhD candidate in Political Science  Aarhus University  November 2020 – October 2023
MSc in Economics and Political Science  University of Milan  2019
BA in Political Sciences  University of Milan  2017
